instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
Hi, i have an a2337 logic board. When i plug it in to power and use a usb-c to hdmi adapter it shows the extended display on my monitor. The cursor shows up and i can move it around but i cant see the main display no matter what i do.

Is there any way to get the main display on an external monitor with just the logic board?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Tried external monitor disconnecting internal LCD?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
Hi thanks, currently the only thing hooked up to the logic board is the usb-c board with power on one input and on the other an adapter with hdmi keyboard and mouse

I have openboardviewer and the 820-02016.bvr Is it possible to short lid_open to ground or something?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Check mirroring options...

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Ive tried every keyboard combination i could find to try to mirror the displays

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
Do you get image on internal LCD?
Can you see top menu bar?
Mirror display options not there?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
Sorry i didnt mention before i dont have anything but the logic board and the usb-c board

Here is an image of what i see

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Looks like it would possibly be IPD_LID_OPEN_1V8 but i dont see a testpoint for it

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
If you get image, lid signal should be good.
UR200 is in charge with lid sensors detection.
It should have high level (close to 1.8V) on all inputs and output.

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Dont i want to tell it the lid is closed though so the display would be mirrored instead of extended?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Did you check mentioned signals?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Im having a hard time finding test pads in openboardview when i click on a test pad for example TP1569 it doesnt show it as connected to anything

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: IPD_LID_OPEN_R_1V8 is reading 1.8 volts on my multimeter

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Oh i just short that to ground and it works

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: The next step is to force DFU mode. Do you know if there are test pads for that?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
You can use SWV011 pads.
Need to solder RV020, if not present on the board.

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Solder the left 2 or the right 2?

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
I don't understand...

Solder wire 1-2; cut it once machine appears on AC2.

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: I meant does SWV011 or RV020 gets soldered together

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Sorry i meant is there a pad for IPD_LID_OPEN_R_1V8 as that is a very small spot to solder to

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
You can tie together pins 3 & 4 of UR200.
Or use any pin of RR203.

Removing RR200/1 should have same effect.
But leaving UR200 inputs floating on air is not the best idea; should force them to ground.

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: So i soldered SWV011 And its not booting into DFU. It just keeps booting into recovery mode

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Does it need to be a 1k resistor

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: Not the greatest soldering but its on there. I didnt want to apply too much heat to the board

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message:
Use a wire, not resistor.
You must cut that wire, when machine appears in AC2.

Is RV020 placed on the board?
If not, solder it.

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: RV020 is on this board

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: If boots in recovery, try to recover then.

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: I dont have wifi working on it at the moment

threads.title: A2337 second display
threads.message: I got it in DFU, thanks for all your help
